column4: Google can disrupt car industry but is no automaker  Daimler says

column4: Taiwan stocks fall; Apple suppliers  TransAsia down
column5: TAIPEI  Feb 6 Taiwan stocks fell 0.55 percent on Friday  weighed by losses in Apple Inc's suppliers such as Largan Precision.     The main TAIEX index dipped to 9 464.08 as of 0217 GMT.     Largan  a camera phone module supplier of Apple and some other smartphone makers  dropped nearly 5 percent. Touch panel supplier TPK Holdings was off 2 percent.     TransAsia Airway lost 3.4 percent  extending its fall in the last two sessions since its Flight GE235 plunged into a river in downtow

column4: Breakingviews: Can maker dons tin hat to reveal $6.6 bln approach
column5: LONDON (Reuters Breakingviews) - London-listed Rexam  is going out on a limb over sale talks with U.S. rival Ball . Beyond disclosing discussions that may or may not go anywhere  the UK company revealed the deal price under consideration  some 4.3 billion pounds ($6.6 billion). The decision looks brave - or designed to force Ball's hand.

column4: Drinks can maker Ball in talks to buy UK rival Rexam
column5: British drinks can maker Rexam Plc  said it is in talks to be bought by U.S. rival Ball Corp  for 4.3 billion pounds ($6.6 billion)  a deal that would form an industry giant better equipped to withstand rising aluminum costs.

column4: Bond funds worldwide attract most inflows since Sept '09: BofA
column5: NEW YORK Investors worldwide poured $21.5 billion into bond funds in the weekly reporting period ended Wednesday  before Friday's data showing U.S. job growth rose solidly in January  data from a Bank of America Merrill Lynch Global Research report showed on Friday.

column4: Exclusive: Startup backed by Goldman  other banks may offer new research  data platform
column5: NEW YORK A startup backed by Wall Street banks plans to create a digital marketplace for research and data products in a potentially ambitious foray into the financial technology and information businesses  people familiar with the matter said.

column4: Factbox: Union strikes at 11 U.S. refineries  chemical plants
column5: The United Steelworkers union (USW) on Friday called strikes at BP Plc's  plants in Whiting  Indiana  and Toledo  Ohio  taking to 11 the number of refineries and chemical plants affected by the first nationwide industrial action in the oil industry since 1980.

column4: Cameco earnings rise 14 pct on higher realized uranium prices
column5: Feb 6 Canadian uranium producer Cameco Corp   reported on Friday a 14 percent increase in quarterly earnings  helped by higher uranium prices and a decline in the average unit cost of sales.

column5: Feb 5 Royal Bank of Canada (RBC) and Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CIBC)  two of Canada's biggest banks  looked at buying U.S. lender Boston Private Bank & Trust Co  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column5: LONDON  Feb 6 Greek bank shares fell on Friday  capping a week of wild trading swings  as brokers cut their forecasts on worries over dwindling deposits and the effects of political brinksmanship between Greece and its creditors.

column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Feb 6 Canada's National Energy Board approved two of Enbridge Inc's condition filings on the reversed Line 9 pipeline on Friday  but also imposed additional ones on the company.
